intro: Pycnandra paucinervia, commonly known as the narrow-veined pycnandra, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with prominent midribs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain numerous tiny seeds. Pycnandra paucinervia is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
